title: A Country Practice: On the Threshold: Part 2
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australia - Rural conditions
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medicine, Rural
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Rural health services - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Sociology, Rural
abstract: Episode 636 of the long-running, Logie award-winning Australian series set in Wandin Valley, NSW.
description: One of Australia's most popular primetime television programmes, 'A Country Practice' is a drama series about the residents of the small country town of Wandin Valley, New South Wales. The storyline focused on the town's medical clinic, hospital, veterinary practice and pub. Over 1000 episodes were produced for the Seven Network between 1981 and 1993. In this episode, it's Jo and Michael's wedding day. Michael tries to calm his nerves by helping at the hospital, while Frank struggles to recapture a herd of escaped goats. The wedding celebrant is injured, but pastor pastor Steve Murray saves the day. Cast includes Shane Porteous as Terence Elliott, Diane Smith as Alex Fraser, Lorrae Desmond as Shirley Dean, Brian Wenzel as Frank Gilroy, Joan Sydney as Margaret 'Maggie' Sloan, Kate Raison as Cathy Hayden, John Tarrant as Matthew Tyler, Joyce Jacobs as Esme Watson, Gordon Piper as Bob Hatfield, Syd Heylen as Vernon 'Cookie' Locke, Josephine Mitchell as Jo Loveday, and Brett Climo as Michael Langley. Also features guest star Gary Foley as pastor Steve Murray.
